services.heading: David Mark Seidel has a package to fit every couple’s needs and budget. He will customize one just for you that is perfect for your ceremony. He is an ordained minister and wedding officiant in good standing and  licensed to perform weddings in the United States.

data.heading: Civil Ceremony
data.description: Our Civil Ceremony is the most basic of our packages. These ceremonies are perfect for couples looking to tie the knot in a quick, but meaningful manner.
points: Lovely, keepsake certificates of marriage suitable for framing
Experienced, professional and caring officiant for your ceremony
Vocal music can be sung by David if requested
Marriage license(s) sent by certified mail back to the County Clerk of Record
Can be performed anywhere within Mecklenburg County – outside of county may include a small travel fee

data.heading: Planned Ceremony
points: Ceremony, wedding vows, and custom script development for the big day
As much phone and e-mail communication and personal consultation as needed
Experienced, professional and caring officiant for your ceremony
Vocal music can be sung by David if requested
Lovely, keepsake certificates of marriage suitable for framing
Marriage license(s) sent by certified mail back to the County Clerk of Record
Travel within Mecklenburg County – a small travel fee may incur if outside the county
Optional professional music coordination for the ceremony with our in-house audio technician.

text: We met with him and he was so amazing! He heard our story agreed to married us and made it a truly unforgettable experience. He gave us guidance and was great to work with. He is a great man of God and officiant. I recommend him for anyone looking to have a great marriage experience.

I am a professional musician who for the past 7 years have played for weddings almost every weekend. I have experienced a variety of officiants and Reverend David Mark Seidel stood out to me. He was so sweet and uplifting. His approach was unique and creative. I am planning my own wedding in September of 2018 and am planning on using his services so that I can also have such a warm, intimate atmosphere at my wedding.

Reverend David was performed my nephew's weeding in a very professional and friendly manner. I like the fact that he likes to come and hour earlier before the ceremony to talk to groom and bride and meet the family member.. It was a very nice and sweet ceremony. Thank you Reverend David.

Our day couldn’t have been made without Reverend David marrying us! He was extremely warming and you felt as if he truly cared about your wedding and marriage. He was extremely professional, helpful, and encouraging through all the wedding planning. We highly recommend anyone seeking to get married to book Rev. David!

We just had our wedding this weekend. Thank you Reverend David. The ceremony was beautiful. We appreciate your attention to details. We also like the fact that he time to get to know us and tried to accommodate our wishes.
Great person and very charasmatic and really friendly and easy to talk too

I have worked directly with David for a long time, he is very dedicated and take great pride in the job he does. He puts the bride and groom first and will ALWAYS make your special day that much more wonderful. Don't waste time looking for other Wedding Officiants, book him if you can, he is a busy man that really cares and is very talented!!!
I had the opportunity to met and experience a great and personal ceremony when Reverend David Seidel married by son and daughter in law. He had a special touch and it was just the best!

Rev. Seidel was a wonderful officiant to work with. He did an excellent job of preparing us for our wedding day and listening to our goals for our service and ceremony. His personality and demeanor were truly a delight!!
Pastor Seidel was very warm and welcoming. Couldn't have asked for a more beautiful ceremony.

I was very involved in the planning of my brothers wedding and was having trouble finding an officiant who could conduct the ceremony in Spanish (as brides family would be streaming from overseas). Reverend David Mark Seidel conducted a beautiful ceremony in all spanish and made it feel very personal with moments of laughter as well as moments with tears. Received so many positive comments after ceremony. Could not be happier with the way it all turned out.

Reverend David assisted us with a beautiful wedding ceremony. Not only did he have hart warming speech but also performed it in Spanish for us, family and, friends. Reverend David was kind and explained every step to us. He was very reliable and professional and would definitely recommend him if you are planning to get married. Thank you so much Reverend David!!!!

David's remarkable uplifting personality and attitude towards a loving ceremony made it all the more. He was extremely sensitive to the newlyweds needs and emotions they were feeling. I would encourage everyone thinking about marriage to sit down and chat with David and you'll see that he will be the perfect person to officiate. Thank you David for making a beautiful ceremony happen with such grace and ease.

If a white hat is the sign of a man with a big heart for sharing the truth about love then David Mark Seidel is the best officiant reverend I have experienced in some time. David intentionally honored the precious souls in the family that contributed to the BIG story of the wedding couple. He did it with humility while gracefully prompting others in the family to speak about their relationship with the couple. The ceremony flowed with emotion as I felt led to understand what marriage for Kyle and Bri would mean for them. Kudos to a a very polished man of God!

Weddings are a time of unity, laughter and happily ever after. Reverend David Seidel helped our family to accomplish all those things. His loving, yet professional, demeanor struck just the right note. His sense of humor and understanding heart helped us create a day we will remember always.
As the song goes, ' Love isn't Love until you give it away.' I am sure that everyone at the wedding loved a bit more deeply as he guided us all through this song and message. Thank You!

My son and his new wife were honored to have Reverend David officiate their wedding last Sunday. He made the event especially poignant and personal. I highly recommend David to bring your loved ones together!

David was so responsive and flexible and only ever cared about making sure the moment my wife and I shared was as special and memorable as possible. Just be upfront with him and he will deliver ten fold. He is the most sincere and honest person you will ever meet!

Rev. David was Amazing. He made our ceremony a family event. He involved our kids in every aspect. He spoke the words that my husband and I have been wanting to say to each other we just didn’t know how.

The most important and wonderful thing he did for us was, He Sang a very special song for Mike and I. Our family couldn’t have asked for a better day. Rev. Davis is the reason. We wish him happiness, good health, but most of all Love and Laughter for the New Year.
Great experience. One of a kind character. Made my daughter's wedding a unique occasion. Great personality, very likable fellow.
This was my first experience being at a wedding ceremony. He was great! Loved how he kept a smile! Thank David!
Rev.Seidel is wonderful. Officiated Stanley and Wanda Wright wedding on 11/09/17.Great guy ! Family and friends very pleased. Thanks Rev. Seidel we love you.

Reverend David was an all around AMAZING minister, leader and witness in the Wright’s wedding ceremony. I served as a Professional Videographer for this wedding and what stood out to me the most was Reverend David’s ability to connect with the essence of his peers.
He was sharp, on time, and even stayed after the ceremony to connect with everyone who was gracefully involved.
Highly recommend this professional here! There isn’t any other minister you’d need.

D would love to share my appreciation for Rev.D.Seidel. The marriage sermon for my brother and his new wife was professional but yet the Spirit of God was present. He was serious but there was times when he made us all laugh, this was my first time meeting him and if i ever get blessed to get married if i can not have Rev. David Seidel I sure pray that it is someone like him. God Bless you Reverend Seidel.
Reverend David Mark Seidel was very professional, involved, and encouraging during the process. I would recommend him to anyone.

I struggle to find words depicting how perfect our ceremony, and just day in general, was. Everything came together as it should, and I believe it to be so because of Reverend Seidel’s leading role. His graciousness, leadership, positive attitude, and loving aura, smoothed the day over like a polished stone. Everyone went out of their way to compliment him, and they weren’t even aware of the phenomenal person he was behind the scenes. He is now my friend. He is now my family. I can not thank him enough. That being said, I highly recommend having him benefit any services he offers that you are in need of. Again to Reverend Seidel… Thank you. Thank you, thank you.
David was excellent! He was everything you want a wedding officiant to be!.
My son and daughter-in-law chose the right man for the job. Very professional but also lots of fun. I wish him the best!
Wedding was spectacular, David was awesome! He meet our expectations. Every one was very pleased with the way he run the Ceremony. My Mother and her husband were very happy with his service.
Thank you David.

Reverend David did a great job on our wedding with short short notice. He made it to the ceremony with plenty of time and was able to check out the ceremony set up to see the layout of where he would be standing and how we would be coming in; he even was a little involved in the decision making process. He gave a beautiful bilingual ceremony that everyone enjoyed, so I would easily recommend him for anyone interested in a bilingual ceremony.

contact.subHeader: Please fill out the information below

welcome.heading: David Mark Seidel - Wedding Officiant
welcome.headingSub: Wedding Officiant, Multi-Lingual, Multi-Cultural, Ambassador of Love
paras: For more than 35 years, David has been performing ceremonies both spiritual and secular all over the  world.  He is a student and practitioner of World Faiths, among them: Christian, Jewish, Hindu, and Native American.  He spent 10 years of dedicated scriptural study in monastic settings both in New York and India.  His successful married life is 38 years strong and that was preceded by a 10 year blossoming friendship to his wife Jeanette ( and he is father to the handsomest 16 year old young man in Charlotte,  son Jonathan ).

He currently officiates non-denominational weddings in the Charlotte region and beyond! He approaches the marriage ceremony as a wondrous vessel infused with joy and celebration.   Yes, you will be married and you will have a very great time! The sacred and the sublime are guests at your wedding.  Allow David to meet with you and create a ceremony and an event that launches your marriage with exquisite positive energy, a day that will “love you back to life again and again.

AND, his wedding team includes the most amazing DJ, the classic 1958 Rolls Royce Silver Cloud and the finest musicians and performers from all musical genres. If you are interested in booking David as your Officiant you can reach him at 704.526.7284, or david@davidmarkseidel.com for availability. See Officiating Services page on this site. David is multi-lingual Spanish/English and also is skilled in Hindi/Sanskrit for Indian weddings and Pujas. Same Sex Unions are Welcome.

aboutUs.heading: Hello
aboutUs.subHeading: Welcome to our wedding website! You should find all information you need to share our special day with us.

content.heading: Guests
paras: Respectfully, only children of immediate family will be in attendance, otherwise this will be an adult only event.

content.heading: Menu
paras: Dinner will be catered by Midwood Smokehouse (local Carolina BBQ restaurant); there will be vegetarian options -  if you have any dietary restrictions, please indicate them on the RSVP page.

content.heading: Event Parking
paras: Parking is charged at the prevailing rate of $18.00/day for self-parking and $24.00/day for valet parking. However, there are numerous cheaper garages and lots very close to the hotel.

content.heading: Accomodations
paras:
We have blocked a book of discounted rooms in Uptown Charlotte at the Holiday Inn Charlotte Center City under 'Bacino/Gonzales' (View on Map). The hotel is just around the corner from the ceremony/reception (Levine Museum). Please use the link below or call the hotel at 704.335.5400 (mention our names) to reserve your room.
Reserve Room Bacino/Gonzales
Also, note that you must book by 9/26/2018 to get the group rate.

content.heading: Travel
paras: If you are flying in to Charlotte International Airport, you can get an Uber/Lyft to the hotel for about $15. There is also a shuttle (Sprinter Shuttle) that will take you near the hotel for a few dollars.

details.heading: Ceremony
paras: Ceremony will be held in the atrium of the Levine Museum of New South.

details.heading: Cocktail Hour
paras: After the ceremony, we will start the celebrations with cocktails and live music. Guests will have full access to the first floor exhibits of the museum during these hours.

details.heading: Reception
paras: Guest will enjoy a full Southern BBQ dinner in the Harris Hall of the museum. Post dinner be prepared to dance the night away!
In lieu of gifts please dontate to charities

thingsToDo.heading: Things to Do
headingParas: If you're in town for the whole weekend, here are some of our suggestions on how to get to know Charlotte better. We have broken our favorite things to do by types below.
Beer - Charlotte is home to over 30 local breweries. If you're looking for a fun afternoon, you can walk the Rail Trail in South End or stroll around NoDa to hit up some of the more popular spots.

Food - While Charlotte might not be on the culinary level of bigger cities like New York or Chicago, the food scene is rapidly growing. And for all of you Yankees, Charlotte knows how to do Southern food right.
Activities - You don't need to eat or drink to have fun!

cards.para: Charlotte's own bustling food destination in the heart of the city! Great coffee, food, and even a few bars inside with tvs.
Our first date spot! Great coffee and sandwiches.
Good food, but better cocktails. Great for people watching if you sit outside.
Classic fried food joint that's been there since the 60s. Actually, you almost go back in time when you go there since the workers dress in all white and require cash only.

sideNotes.heading: Walkable from hotel
sideNotes.text: no - but can take light rail

cards.para: Always packed - typically Southern BBQ. It's fun to sit outside.

sideNotes.heading: Walkable from hotel
sideNotes.text: no - but can take light rail

cards.para: Great reviews and even better Southern comfort food.
Award winning BBQ haunt. Some people claim it's the best in Charlotte.

sideNotes.heading: Walkable from hotel
sideNotes.text: no - but can take light rail

cards.para: Cool craft beer spot in the ever bustling Southend Neighborhood.
The most popular brewery in Charlotte. Tons of picnic tables for soaking in the sun; they also usually have a band on Saturdays.

sideNotes.heading: Walkable from hotel
sideNotes.text: no - but can take light rail

cards.para: One of my favorite breweries since it's a little smaller and cozier. Plus they have free pretzels!

sideNotes.heading: Walkable from hotel
sideNotes.text: no - but can take light rail

cards.para: Huge German style Bier Garden. Definitely the biggest brewery in Charlotte. Huge indoor and outdoor area.
Small but always packed brewery in the NoDa neighborhood. Board games inside and cornhole outside.
German brewhouse with great food in the heart of NoDa

sideNotes.heading: Walkable from hotel
sideNotes.text: no - but can take light rail

cards.para: Newest brewery in Charlotte - owned and operated by all women!

sideNotes.heading: Walkable from hotel
sideNotes.text: no - but can take light rail

cards.para: Catawba finally expanded from Asheville, NC to Charlotte and everyone loves it. Highly rates 4.8/5 stars on google.
Nestled in the heard of Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Comes with plenty of character.
Another new brewery to Charlotte. Tons of space inside and a great food truck stationed outside.

If you have the time on Saturday, this is a cool place. Guests can enjoy whitewater rafting and kayaking, flatwater kayaking, stand-up paddle boarding, rock climbing, zip lines, ropes courses, a canopy tour, and mountain biking on the 30+ mile trail system.
We actually have not been here, but have heard it's a fun time.
Typical large amusement park; owned by Cedar Point
Charlotte is a very walkable modern city; also being October, the weather should be nice. It's small enough that you can explore the whole city in a about an hour or two.
